title: Quiz: How much do you know about the new Covid rules?
description: A top police office has said it's "preposterous" people don't know lockdown rules - so test yourself.

title: Home-schooling: How to help your child’s online learning
description: There are plenty of online resources to help while schools are closed to most pupils.

title: Covid: Johnson's bike ride 'didn't break rules'
description: Downing Street defends the PM, while the Met Police chief says he did not act "against the law".

title: Covid-19: Rule-breakers 'increasingly likely' to be fined - Cressida Dick
description: People are still holding house parties, raves and gambling gatherings, the UK's most senior police officer says.

title: Sriwijaya Air crash: Plane passed inspection last month
description: Officials said the plane was deemed airworthy in December after it was grounded for several months.

title: Florida manatee with 'Trump' etched on back prompts investigation
description: An investigation is launched after the marine mammal was found with the president's name on its body.

title: Supermarket staff: 'We're lucky if people wear masks'
description: Shop workers say the third lockdown is the worst ever for customers not sticking to safety rules.

title: Manager Jepson leaves Liverpool
description: Liverpool manager Vicky Jepson leaves by mutual consent with the club third in the Women's Championship.

title: Covid: 2020 saw most excess deaths since World War Two
description: Last year saw 697,000 deaths registered in the UK - 15% above what would be expected.

title: Royal Mail names areas hit by Covid postal delays
description: Deliveries may be delayed in 28 areas due to "resourcing issues", the postal group says.

title: In pictures: Aurora Borealis lights up sky above Scotland
description: The Northern Lights were visible overnight from Shetland, Moray and the Highlands.

title: Anita Rani to join Emma Barnett on BBC Radio 4's Woman's Hour
description: The Countryfile star will present the Friday and Saturday editions of the BBC Radio 4 programme.

title: Covid: Parents' warning after daughter, 25, dies
description: The Jones family all got coronavirus at Christmas - but it was Lauren who didn't survive.

title: Smith did not deliberately scuff up crease - Australia captain Paine
description: Steve Smith did not deliberately scuff up the crease during the final day of the third Test against India, says Australia captain Tim Paine.

title: Retail sales in 2020 'worst for 25 years'
description: A slump in demand for fashion and homeware during lockdown left many retailers struggling.

title: Season delayed as Australian and Chinese GPs postponed
description: The 2021 Australian and Chinese Grands Prix are postponed because of Covid-19 restrictions in the countries.

title: Lisa Montgomery: Judge halts execution of only woman on US death row
description: The judge orders a mental competency hearing to be held - just hours before the scheduled execution.

title: Son of a groundsman, brother of a wrestler - Lawrence on verge of England debut
description: Dan Lawrence grew up living on a cricket ground. Now he is poised to make his England bow in Sri Lanka.

title: 'One of my favourite people in the world' - Richards on what Milner is really like
description: Micah Richards reveals what his former team-mate James Milner is really like - and why he admires him so much.

title: The Papers: Lockdown rules latest, and PM's bike ride
description: There are a mix of stories on Tuesday's newspaper front pages.

title: Silencing Trump: How 'big tech' is taking Trumpism offline
description: Within days tech giants have moved to "deplatform" the president and some of his supporters.

title: Capitol police officer hailed as a 'hero'
description: Footage of the riot shows Mr Goodman lure a mob away from the Senate and the lawmakers hiding inside.

title: Patriots coach Belichick rejects Medal of Freedom from Trump
description: New England Patriots coach Bill Belichick turns down Donald Trump's offer, citing the Capitol riots.

title: Why this female garbage truck driver hopes more women will join her
description: Belinda Janson hopes she won't be the only woman driving garbage trucks in Ipswich, Australia, for long.

title: Covid: Life on the frontline as part of an emergency ambulance crew
description: An emergency ambulance crew member tells of the reality of life on the NHS frontline.

title: Brexit leaves Spain's Costa Brits facing dilemmas
description: British expats in Spain tell the BBC how the new post-Brexit rules have changed their lives.

title: Smart locks: Convenience comes with security doubts
description: More people are using digital locks for their houses, but how secure are they?

title: 20-year-old Covid patient couldn't tell parents 'I love you'
description: A 20-year-old man who spent a week in intensive care says many young people are in denial about Covid.

title: Which Covid vaccine is better? Pfizer v Oxford v Moderna
description: Three vaccines have been approved in the UK - what are the differences between them?

title: Stammering: 'I thought it made me a failure'
description: Joe Biden will be the first known president with a stammer to take office.

title: Plastic surgery: Surgeons who target black women and use influencers for promotion
description: A BBC investigation finds women suffered life-changing conditions after going to Turkey for surgery.
